00020 
00021 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00022   Defines for ring buffers
00023  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00024 #define SER_BUF_SIZE               (128)               // serial buffer in bytes (power 2)
00025 #define SER_BUF_MASK               (SER_BUF_SIZE-1ul)  // buffer size mask
00026 
00027 /* Buffer read / write macros */
00028 #define SER_BUF_RESET(serBuf)      (serBuf.rdIdx = serBuf.wrIdx = 0)
00029 #define SER_BUF_WR(serBuf, dataIn) (serBuf.data[SER_BUF_MASK & serBuf.wrIdx++] = (dataIn))
00030 #define SER_BUF_RD(serBuf)         (serBuf.data[SER_BUF_MASK & serBuf.rdIdx++])
00031 #define SER_BUF_EMPTY(serBuf)      (serBuf.rdIdx == serBuf.wrIdx)
00032 #define SER_BUF_FULL(serBuf)       (serBuf.rdIdx == serBuf.wrIdx+1)
00033 #define SER_BUF_COUNT(serBuf)      (SER_BUF_MASK & (serBuf.wrIdx - serBuf.rdIdx))
00034 
00035 // buffer type
00036 typedef struct __SER_BUF_T {
00037   unsigned char data[SER_BUF_SIZE];
00038   unsigned int wrIdx;
00039   unsigned int rdIdx;
00040 } SER_BUF_T;
00041 
00042 unsigned long          ser_txRestart;                  // NZ if TX restart is required
00043 unsigned short         ser_lineState;                  // ((msr << 8) | (lsr))
00044 SER_BUF_T              ser_out;                        // Serial data buffers
00045 SER_BUF_T              ser_in;
00046 
00047 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048   open the serial port
00049  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00050 void ser_OpenPort (char portNum) {
00051 
00052   if ( portNum == 0 )
00053   {
00054         /* Port 0 */
00055         NVIC_DisableIRQ(UART0_IRQn);
00056         LPC_PINCON->PINSEL0 &= ~0x000000F0;
00057         LPC_PINCON->PINSEL0 |= 0x00000050;     /* RxD0 is P0.3 and TxD0 is P0.2 */
00058   }
00059   else
00060   {
00061         /* Port 1 */
00062         NVIC_DisableIRQ(UART1_IRQn);
00063         LPC_PINCON->PINSEL4 &= ~0x0000000F;
00064         LPC_PINCON->PINSEL4 |= 0x0000000A;    /* Enable RxD1 P2.1, TxD1 P2.0 */
00065   }
00066   return;
00067 }
00068 
00069 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00070   close the serial port
00071  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00072 void ser_ClosePort (char portNum ) {
00073   if ( portNum == 0 )
00074   {
00075         /* POrt 0 */
00076         LPC_PINCON->PINSEL0 &= ~0x000000F0;
00077         /* Disable the interrupt in the VIC and UART controllers */
00078         LPC_UART0->IER = 0;
00079         NVIC_DisableIRQ(UART0_IRQn);
00080   }
00081   else
00082   {
00083         /* Port 1 */
00084         LPC_PINCON->PINSEL4 &= ~0x0000000F;
00085         /* Disable the interrupt in the VIC and UART controllers */
00086         LPC_UART1->IER = 0;
00087         NVIC_DisableIRQ(UART1_IRQn);
00088   }
00089   return;
00090 }
00091 
00092 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00093   initialize the serial port
00094  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00095 void ser_InitPort0 (unsigned long baudrate, unsigned int  databits,
00096                   unsigned int  parity,   unsigned int  stopbits) {
00097 
00098   unsigned char lcr_p, lcr_s, lcr_d;
00099   unsigned int dll;
00100   unsigned int pclkdiv, pclk;
00101 
00102   switch (databits) {
00103     case 5:                                            // 5 Data bits
00104       lcr_d = 0x00;
00105     break;
00106     case 6:                                            // 6 Data bits
00107       lcr_d = 0x01;
00108     break;
00109     case 7:                                            // 7 Data bits
00110       lcr_d = 0x02;
00111     break;
00112     case 8:                                            // 8 Data bits
00113     default:
00114       lcr_d = 0x03;
00115     break;
00116   }
00117 
00118   switch (stopbits) {
00119     case 1:                                            // 1,5 Stop bits
00120     case 2:                                            // 2   Stop bits
00121       lcr_s = 0x04;
00122     break;
00123     case 0:                                            // 1   Stop bit
00124     default:
00125       lcr_s = 0x00;
00126     break;
00127   }
00128 
00129   switch (parity) {
00130     case 1:                                            // Parity Odd
00131       lcr_p = 0x08;
00132     break;
00133     case 2:                                            // Parity Even
00134       lcr_p = 0x18;
00135     break;
00136     case 3:                                            // Parity Mark
00137       lcr_p = 0x28;
00138     break;
00139     case 4:                                            // Parity Space
00140       lcr_p = 0x38;
00141     break;
00142     case 0:                                            // Parity None
00143     default:
00144       lcr_p = 0x00;
00145     break;
00146   }
00147 
00148   SER_BUF_RESET(ser_out);                              // reset out buffer
00149   SER_BUF_RESET(ser_in);                               // reset in buffer
00150 
00151   /* Bit 6~7 is for UART0 */
00152   pclkdiv = (LPC_SC->PCLKSEL0 >> 6) & 0x03;
00153 
00154   switch ( pclkdiv )
00155   {
00156         case 0x00:
00157         default:
00158           pclk = SystemCoreClock/4;
00159           break;
00160         case 0x01:
00161           pclk = SystemCoreClock;
00162           break;
00163         case 0x02:
00164           pclk = SystemCoreClock/2;
00165           break;
00166         case 0x03:
00167           pclk = SystemCoreClock/8;
00168           break;
00169   }
00170 
00171   dll = (pclk/16)/baudrate ;    /*baud rate */
00172   LPC_UART0->FDR = 0;                             // Fractional divider not used
00173   LPC_UART0->LCR = 0x80 | lcr_d | lcr_p | lcr_s;  // Data bits, Parity,   Stop bit
00174   LPC_UART0->DLL = dll;                           // Baud Rate depending on PCLK
00175   LPC_UART0->DLM = (dll >> 8);                    // High divisor latch
00176   LPC_UART0->LCR = 0x00 | lcr_d | lcr_p | lcr_s;  // DLAB = 0
00177   LPC_UART0->IER = 0x03;                          // Enable TX/RX interrupts
00178 
00179   LPC_UART0->FCR = 0x07;                                /* Enable and reset TX and RX FIFO. */
00180   ser_txRestart = 1;                                   // TX fifo is empty
00181 
00182   /* Enable the UART Interrupt */
00183   NVIC_EnableIRQ(UART0_IRQn);
00184   return;
00185 }
00186 
00187 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00188   initialize the serial port
00189  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00190 void ser_InitPort1 (unsigned long baudrate, unsigned int  databits,
00191                   unsigned int  parity,   unsigned int  stopbits) {
00192 
00193   unsigned char lcr_p, lcr_s, lcr_d;
00194   unsigned int dll;
00195   unsigned int pclkdiv, pclk;
00196 
00197   switch (databits) {
00198     case 5:                                            // 5 Data bits
00199       lcr_d = 0x00;
00200     break;
00201     case 6:                                            // 6 Data bits
00202       lcr_d = 0x01;
00203     break;
00204     case 7:                                            // 7 Data bits
00205       lcr_d = 0x02;
00206     break;
00207     case 8:                                            // 8 Data bits
00208     default:
00209       lcr_d = 0x03;
00210     break;
00211   }
00212 
00213   switch (stopbits) {
00214     case 1:                                            // 1,5 Stop bits
00215     case 2:                                            // 2   Stop bits
00216       lcr_s = 0x04;
00217     break;
00218     case 0:                                            // 1   Stop bit
00219     default:
00220       lcr_s = 0x00;
00221     break;
00222   }
00223 
00224   switch (parity) {
00225     case 1:                                            // Parity Odd
00226       lcr_p = 0x08;
00227     break;
00228     case 2:                                            // Parity Even
00229       lcr_p = 0x18;
00230     break;
00231     case 3:                                            // Parity Mark
00232       lcr_p = 0x28;
00233     break;
00234     case 4:                                            // Parity Space
00235       lcr_p = 0x38;
00236     break;
00237     case 0:                                            // Parity None
00238     default:
00239       lcr_p = 0x00;
00240     break;
00241   }
00242 
00243   SER_BUF_RESET(ser_out);                              // reset out buffer
00244   SER_BUF_RESET(ser_in);                               // reset in buffer
00245 
00246   /* Bit 8,9 are for UART1 */
00247   pclkdiv = (LPC_SC->PCLKSEL0 >> 8) & 0x03;
00248 
00249   switch ( pclkdiv )
00250   {
00251         case 0x00:
00252         default:
00253           pclk = SystemCoreClock/4;
00254           break;
00255         case 0x01:
00256           pclk = SystemCoreClock;
00257           break;
00258         case 0x02:
00259           pclk = SystemCoreClock/2;
00260           break;
00261         case 0x03:
00262           pclk = SystemCoreClock/8;
00263           break;
00264   }
00265 
00266   dll = (pclk/16)/baudrate ;    /*baud rate */
00267   LPC_UART1->FDR = 0;                             // Fractional divider not used
00268   LPC_UART1->LCR = 0x80 | lcr_d | lcr_p | lcr_s;  // Data bits, Parity,   Stop bit
00269   LPC_UART1->DLL = dll;                           // Baud Rate depending on PCLK
00270   LPC_UART1->DLM = (dll >> 8);                    // High divisor latch
00271   LPC_UART1->LCR = 0x00 | lcr_d | lcr_p | lcr_s;  // DLAB = 0
00272   LPC_UART1->IER = 0x03;                          // Enable TX/RX interrupts
00273 
00274   LPC_UART1->FCR = 0x07;                                /* Enable and reset TX and RX FIFO. */
00275   ser_txRestart = 1;                                   // TX fifo is empty
00276 
00277   /* Enable the UART Interrupt */
00278   NVIC_EnableIRQ(UART1_IRQn);
00279   return;
00280 }
00281 
00282 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00283   read data from serial port
00284  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00285 int ser_Read (char *buffer, const int *length) {
00286   int bytesToRead, bytesRead;
00287 
00288   /* Read *length bytes, block if *bytes are not avaialable     */
00289   bytesToRead = *length;
00290   bytesToRead = (bytesToRead < (*length)) ? bytesToRead : (*length);
00291   bytesRead = bytesToRead;
00292 
00293   while (bytesToRead--) {
00294     while (SER_BUF_EMPTY(ser_in));                     // Block until data is available if none
00295     *buffer++ = SER_BUF_RD(ser_in);
00296   }
00297   return (bytesRead);
00298 }
00299 
00300 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00301   write data to the serial port
00302  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00303 int ser_Write (char portNum, const char *buffer, int *length) {
00304   int  bytesToWrite, bytesWritten;
00305 
00306   // Write *length bytes
00307   bytesToWrite = *length;
00308   bytesWritten = bytesToWrite;
00309 
00310   while (!SER_BUF_EMPTY(ser_out));               // Block until space is available if none
00311   while (bytesToWrite) {
00312       SER_BUF_WR(ser_out, *buffer++);            // Read Rx FIFO to buffer
00313       bytesToWrite--;
00314   }
00315 
00316   if (ser_txRestart) {
00317     ser_txRestart = 0;
00318         if ( portNum == 0 )
00319         {
00320           LPC_UART0->THR = SER_BUF_RD(ser_out);             // Write to the Tx Register
00321     }
00322         else
00323         {
00324       LPC_UART1->THR = SER_BUF_RD(ser_out);             // Write to the Tx Register
00325         }
00326   }
00327 
00328   return (bytesWritten);
00329 }
00330 
00331 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00332   check if character(s) are available at the serial interface
00333  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00334 void ser_AvailChar (int *availChar) {
00335 
00336   *availChar = SER_BUF_COUNT(ser_in);
00337 
00338 }

00340 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00341   read the line state of the serial port
00342  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00343 void ser_LineState (unsigned short *lineState) {
00344 
00345   *lineState = ser_lineState;
00346   ser_lineState = 0;
00347 
00348 }

00350 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00351   serial port 0 interrupt
00352  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00353 void UART0_IRQHandler(void)
00354 {
00355   volatile unsigned long iir;
00356 
00357   iir = LPC_UART0->IIR;
00358 
00359   if ((iir & 0x4) || (iir & 0xC)) {            // RDA or CTI pending
00360     while (LPC_UART0->LSR & 0x01) {                 // Rx FIFO is not empty
00361       SER_BUF_WR(ser_in, LPC_UART0->RBR);           // Read Rx FIFO to buffer
00362     }
00363   }
00364   if ((iir & 0x2)) {                           // TXMIS pending
00365         if (SER_BUF_COUNT(ser_out) != 0) {
00366       LPC_UART0->THR = SER_BUF_RD(ser_out);         // Write to the Tx FIFO
00367       ser_txRestart = 0;
00368     }
00369         else {
00370       ser_txRestart = 1;
00371         }
00372   }
00373   ser_lineState = LPC_UART0->LSR & 0x1E;            // update linestate
00374   return;
00375 }
00376 
00377 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00378   serial port 1 interrupt
00379  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00380 void UART1_IRQHandler(void)
00381 {
00382   volatile unsigned long iir;
00383 
00384   iir = LPC_UART1->IIR;
00385 
00386   if ((iir & 0x4) || (iir & 0xC)) {            // RDA or CTI pending
00387     while (LPC_UART1->LSR & 0x01) {                 // Rx FIFO is not empty
00388       SER_BUF_WR(ser_in, LPC_UART1->RBR);           // Read Rx FIFO to buffer
00389     }
00390   }
00391   if ((iir & 0x2)) {                           // TXMIS pending
00392         if (SER_BUF_COUNT(ser_out) != 0) {
00393       LPC_UART1->THR = SER_BUF_RD(ser_out);         // Write to the Tx FIFO
00394       ser_txRestart = 0;
00395     }
00396         else {
00397       ser_txRestart = 1;
00398         }
00399   }
00400   ser_lineState = ((LPC_UART1->MSR<<8)|LPC_UART1->LSR) & 0xE01E;    // update linestate
00401   return;
00402 }
